channel.title: Arkadiusz Kondas Posts
channel.description: Posts about PHP and Machine Learning.

item.title: DMCA, php-ml and copyright boundaries
item.description: Last friday, DMCA took down my GitHub repository. This post will explain the who, the what and how we came to this situation.
item.dc:creator: Arkadiusz Kondas

item.title: What is software architecture?
item.description: Why is the word architect in our industry not always associated well? Should an architect participate in programming? What is software architecture really like? Is it possible to describe architecture in one sentence?
item.dc:creator: Arkadiusz Kondas

item.title: Game networking - effective networking you don't know
item.description: How often do you get involved in effective networking? I want to share with you a completely new experience in which I had the opportunity to participate at the DataWorkshop Club Conf conference.
item.dc:creator: Arkadiusz Kondas

item.title: My thoughts: Superintelligence: Paths, Dangers, Strategies by Nick Bostrom
item.description: This is a pilot post about my thoughts after reading the book. I'm starting with a very good title about artificial intelligence or an unfinished fable of the sparrows.
item.dc:creator: Arkadiusz Kondas

item.title: How to run PHP 8 with JIT support using Docker
item.description: In this post, I will show you how you can start using PHP 8 with JIT support with just one command using Docker.
item.dc:creator: Arkadiusz Kondas

item.title: The right way to call assertion in PHPUnit
item.description: During the preparation of TDD workshops, I began to think about how to write assertions. It turns out that there are several possibilities, but is there the only correct one?
item.dc:creator: Arkadiusz Kondas

item.title: Compiling PHP 8 from source with JIT support
item.description: Initially, this post was to apply to the experiments with JIT alone. However, I encountered some problems at the time of compiling PHP so I decided to share this experience.
item.dc:creator: Arkadiusz Kondas

item.title: 3 Reasons Why PHP is Not Yet Perfect for Machine Learning
item.description: My thoughts on why PHP isn't yet an ideal environment for the universal use of machine learning. I will discuss the three main reasons that are the cause of the current state of affairs.
item.dc:creator: Arkadiusz Kondas

item.title: Text data classification with BBC news article dataset
item.description: The goal of this post is to explore some of the basic techniques that allow working with text data in a machine learning world. I will show how to analyze a collection of text documents that belong to different categories.
item.dc:creator: Arkadiusz Kondas

item.title: Clustering Chicago robberies locations with k-means algorithm
item.description: Using the real dataset of crimes committed in Chicago, I will divide the robbery locations into a bunch of different clusters. Then I will try to visualize results and answer the question of whether we have chosen well parameters for our algorithm.
item.dc:creator: Arkadiusz Kondas

item.title: Predict air pollution with k-Nearest Neighbors and PHP
item.description: Based on air pollution data we will try to predict air quality in a place where we don't have data. I will present k-Nearest Neighbors algorithm and how to implement such prediction in PHP using php-ml.
item.dc:creator: Arkadiusz Kondas

item.title: Binary heap implementation in PHP
item.description: Short explanation what is binary heap and how to implement it in pure PHP from scratch. I will show you how to compare it with native solution (SPL). Performance results are surprising.
item.dc:creator: Arkadiusz Kondas

item.title: When the expert becomes a leader
item.description: Very often in the life of an expert there is a moment when he wants (or it must) to become a leader. These are two different roles that are very difficult to reconcile with each other. In this post I will present some useful techniques that can help experts become a good leader.
item.dc:creator: Arkadiusz Kondas

item.title: Write your own simple chess AI in PHP
item.description: A brief history of how to start writing your own chess engine in PHP. You will learn some basic algorithms, prepare a solid foundation allowing for further development and finally I will consider how you can push your AI further.
item.dc:creator: Arkadiusz Kondas

item.title: What's new in PHP-ML 0.7.0
item.description: A quick overview of new features, changes and fixes in PHP-ML 0.7.0 version
item.dc:creator: Arkadiusz Kondas

item.title: Design Patterns - Strategy
item.description: One of the main assumptions of good project programming is the 'Open/closed' principle, which says that classes should be closed for modification, but open to extension. The strategy pattern allows you to easily maintain this standard in your code.
item.dc:creator: Arkadiusz Kondas
